intro: Panicum tsaratananense, commonly known as the Tsaratanana grass, is a species of grass native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Poaceae family and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or on rocky slopes. It has small, spike-like inflorescences that produce numerous tiny grains, which are adapted for wind dispersal. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
